dt: {bc}a schedule containing names of persons summoned as jurors

dt.t: summoned a {wi}panel{/wi} of 40 citizens for jury duty
The 12-person {wi}panel{/wi} arrived at a guilty verdict.

dt: {bc}a group of persons selected for some service (such as investigation or arbitration)
{bc}a group of persons who discuss before an audience a topic of public interest

dt.t: The {wi}panel{/wi} agreed to accept questions following the discussion.

dt: {bc}a group of entertainers or guests engaged as players in a quiz or guessing game on a radio or television program

dt.t: The quiz show included a {wi}panel{/wi} of three players.

dt: {bc}a separate or distinct part of a surface: such as
{bc}a thin usually rectangular board set in a frame (as in a door)
{bc}a usually sunken or raised section of a surface set off by a margin
{bc}a flat usually rectangular piece of construction material (such as plywood or precast masonry) made to form part of a surface
{bc}a vertical section of fabric (such as a gore)

dt.t: The comic strip was composed of four {wi}panels{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a thin flat piece of wood on which a picture is painted
{bc}a section of a switchboard (as for circuit breakers or for a telephone exchange)

dt.t: … he entered the basement to work on the electrical {wi}panel{/wi} and circuits …

dt: {bc}a usually vertical mount for controls or dials (as of instruments of measurement)

dt.t: Most microwave ovens have a control {wi}panel{/wi} with numbers from 0 to 9.

et: Middle English, piece of cloth, jury list on a piece of parchment, from Anglo-French, from Vulgar Latin {it}*pannellus{/it}, diminutive of Latin {it}pannus{/it}
shortdef: a schedule containing names of persons summoned as jurors
the group of persons so summoned
to furnish or decorate with panels

dt: {bc}a panel on which instruments are mounted

shortdef: a panel on which instruments are mounted; especially : dashboard

dt: {bc}a side section of an automobile body between the door and the trunk or between the door and the hood

dt.t: a dent in a rear/front {wi}quarter panel{/wi}
A lap nine encounter with Robert Pressley's Chevy forced Labonte to pit for left-rear {wi}quarter-panel{/wi} repairs.

Flag emblems became popular automotive dress-up items. They usually were affixed to the front {wi}quarter panel{/wi} and they might be an American stars-and-stripes to show patriotism or they might reflect the flag or colors of the motorist's country of ancestry.

shortdef: a side section of an automobile body between the door and the trunk or between the door and the hood

dt: {bc}the portion of the body paneling of a vehicle that is situated below the doorsills of the passenger compartment

shortdef: the portion of the body paneling of a vehicle that is situated below the doorsills of the passenger compartment

dt: {bc}a battery of solar cells (as on a rooftop)

shortdef: a battery of solar cells (as on a rooftop)

dt: {bc}a {d_link|panel|panel:1} that is part of a larger panel: such as
{bc}a group of persons selected from the members of a panel to perform a specific task
{bc}a thin, usually rectangular piece of material (such as wood) that is part of a larger surface

dt.t: … arranges crosshatching across three panels of differently treated canvas.… each of the three panels is subdivided into three more vertical sections wherein the first {wi}subpanel{/wi} of each main panel reproduces the final {wi}subpanel{/wi} of the preceding one …

… developed a standardized wall assembly using a variable, hexagonal tiling scheme. Beginning with a {wi}subpanel{/wi} of six tiles, the architects modified the hexagonal geometries at their intersections at the center of the panel, while stabilizing the overall shape at the panel's edges.

shortdef: a panel that is part of a larger panel: such as
a group of persons selected from the members of a panel to perform a specific task
a thin, usually rectangular piece of material (such as wood) that is part of a larger surface
